an1.248:1.1: “The foremost of my laymen in first going for refuge are the merchants Tapussa and Bhallika.
an1.249:1.1: … as a donor is the householder Sudatta Anāthapiṇḍika.
an1.250:1.1: … who speak on the teaching is the householder Citta Macchikāsaṇḍika.
an1.251:1.1: … who attract a congregation by the four ways of being inclusive is Hatthaka of Āḷavī.
an1.252:1.1: … who donate fine things is Mahānāma Sakka.
an1.253:1.1: … who donate nice things is the householder Ugga of Vesālī.
an1.254:1.1: … who attend on the Saṅgha is the householder Uggata of Elephant Village.
an1.255:1.1: … who have experiential confidence is Sūrambaṭṭha.
an1.256:1.1: … who have confidence in an individual is Jīvaka Komārabhacca.
an1.257:1.1: … who are intimate is the householder Nakula’s father.”
